intro: Eupatorium fendleri, commonly known as Mexican boneset, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and dry woodlands. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a rough, hairy texture. Eupatorium fendleri is often found in open habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
